config.question: Which of these was true of women in the New England colonies?

choices.content: The economic role of women was marginal.
Divorce was easily obtained through the church.
Women attended church at much higher rates than men.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Within a few years of founding, many New England congregations contained two female members for every male. Historians describe this process as the “feminization of colonial religion.” See L.O. 3.1 What factors explain the remarkable social stability achieved in early New England?
